title: Putin proposes to restart direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on May 15
summary: The Russian president's remarks came after European leaders threatened to exert pressure on Putin if he does not accept an unconditional 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine. Furthermore, should Russia violate the truce, Putin can expect 'massive' and 'coordinated' sanctions from Europe and the US.

title: The Redwans' suspended life in the West Bank: 'We drink, we eat, we cry. We drink, we eat, we bury'
summary: Following the terrorist attacks by Hamas on October 7, 2023, M Le magazine du Monde published profiles of two families caught in the conflict: the Weissmanns, on the Israeli side, and the Redwans, on the Palestinian side. After a year and a half of a never-ending war, with the Gaza Strip under further bombardment, we spoke with them again.

title: In Israel, the Weissmanns are back in their home but disillusioned: 'There was a time when we were idealists'
summary: Following Hamas's terrorist attacks on October 7, 2023, Le Monde published profiles of two families caught in the conflict: the Weissmanns, on the Israeli side, and the Redwans, on the Palestinian side. After a year and a half of a never-ending war, with the Gaza Strip under further bombardment, we spoke with them again.

title: Should screens be banned for 6-year-olds? Even if this seems 'unrealistic,' there are 'protective factors'
summary: Some healthcare professionals recommend banning screens for children under 6 years old. Psychiatrist Serge Tisseron acknowledges in an op-ed for Le Monde that strict prohibition may seem difficult to implement but suggests some precautions that, in his view, could limit the risks of screentime.

title: India claims Pakistan violated ceasefire, says it has retaliated
summary: The two neighbors had earlier on Saturday agreed to a ceasefire after days of deadly cross-border attacks.

title: In French families, equality between fathers and mothers is still far from the norm
summary: The first nationwide survey dedicated to children's environments shows that men only participate in 30% of parenting tasks two months after birth. The situation is even bleaker when it comes to domestic work.

title: Pope Leo XIV lays out vision of his papacy, identifies AI as a main challenge
summary: Addressing a meeting of cardinals two days after being elected the 267th pope, Leo XIV pledged to follow Francis's legacy, uphold social justice and confront the ethical challenges posed by artificial intelligence and modern labor shifts.

title: Trump hails US-China tariff talks a 'total reset'
summary: Senior officials from Washington and Beijing met on Saturday, May 10, for the first time since Trump's sweeping tariffs, seeking to ease tensions amid soaring levies that threaten to upend the global economy.

title: Quebec mandates the use of the formal French 'vous' in schools
summary: A Quebec government plan to 'reinforce civility' in schools has mandated that students and teachers use formal French pronoun in both private and public schools. The change has been met with mixed feelings among teachers.

title: The main challenges awaiting Pope Leo XIV
summary: The most immediate task for Francis's successor is to continue the works of the synod on synodality, the major assembly that, in 2023 and 2024, considered the future of a more inclusive Church.

title: France and Poland sign reciprocal defense treaty that 'learns from history'
summary: The two countries pledged mutual assistance in the event of armed aggression on their territory. Emmanuel Macron specified that this commitment covers 'all military components.'

title: Donald Trump angers Iranians by considering renaming the Persian Gulf
summary: The American president, set to visit Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates from May 12 to May 15, is reportedly considering referring to it as the 'Arabian Gulf.'

title: Chinese-made prom dresses trapped in US-China trade war
summary: Pretty Lady, a Chinese company specializing in evening gowns, based in Chaozhou, Guangdong, sees half of its production sold in the United States. Now, it is being severely affected by American tariffs.

title: In Romania, as the presidential runoff approaches, 'the people have awoken'
summary: Leading the first round of the presidential election on May 4, the far-right candidate, George Simion, is capitalizing on the Social Democrats' discredit.

title: 'What we are witnessing is an absolute disgrace': EU leaders condemn situation in Gaza, but remain divided on Israel
summary: As Israel's humanitarian blockade of Gaza continues after two months, European Union foreign ministers, gathered in Warsaw on Thursday, did not have strong enough words to describe the situation on the ground.

title: Europe approves creation of tribunal to judge 'crimes of aggression' committed by Russia in Ukraine
summary: The tribunal, supported by about 35 countries, is expected to be established within the framework of the Council of Europe and could only prosecute Vladimir Putin once he has left office.

title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal: A publicity boost for Starlink
summary: On April 28, during the unprecedented blackout on the Iberian Peninsula, subscribers to Elon Musk's company's satellite connection boasted about their unaffected internet access.

title: Vladimir Putin's Red Square parade celebrates the offensive in Ukraine
summary: Soldiers and weaponry from the Ukrainian front were featured in the parade to honor the 80th anniversary of Nazi Germany's surrender, attended by international leaders like China's Xi Jinping.
